rest.sentence: An antireflection  film on the surface of the photovoltaic glass can significantly improve the photoelectric conversion efficiency of solar cells
However, AR films prepared by a facile and low-cost sol-gel method usually exhibit poor mechanical properties, which limits their applications

Herein, hexamethoxy methyl melamine resin  was employed as a pore-forming agent in the sol and sacrificial template to prepare porous SiO2 film on glass by a facile sol-gel method and subsequent heat treatment

The obtained SiO2 film showed a high solar transmittance increase of 3.24% in the wavelength range of 380–1100 nm and a good hardness of H when the dosage of CYMEL 303LF is 10 wt%, the short circuit current density and photoelectric conversion efficiency of the solar cell are increased respectively by 1.44 mA/cm2 and 1.08%, compared with the substrate, which is better than most SiO2 films in the previous works
With increasing the dosage of CYMEL 303LF from 0% to 12%, the solar transmittance gain was increased at first and then decreased, while the film hardness was decreased straightly
This was probably because that the introduction of CYMEL 303LF can facilitate the formation of more pores in the SiO2 film, leading to a decrease in the refractive index and film adhesion
Therefore, this work can provide a facile method to prepare high-performance SiO2 as AR film for solar cells.

Download : Download high-res image Download : Download full-size imagePorous superhydrophilic SiO2 antireflection membrane with good optical and mechanical properties was prepared by CYMEL 303LF as pore forming agent.

In recent years, with the gradual exhaustion of non-renewable energy sources such as coal, oil, and natural gas, and increasingly aggravated environmental problems [1,2], solar photovoltaic power generation technology has been paid more and more attention for developing clean and renewable energy sources

However, due to the limitation of the semiconductor material itself and the reflection of sunlight by the photovoltaic glass as a protective cover, the current photoelectric conversion efficiency of solar cells is low
There are two main ways to improve the photoelectric conversion efficiency of solar cells
One is to develop semiconductor materials with higher conversion efficiency, the other is to improve the transmittance of photovoltaic glass
Due to the time-consuming and high cost of developing new materials, it is relatively simple and feasible to improve the transmittance of photovoltaic glass.

In order to improve the transmittance of photovoltaic glass , a thin film is usually coated on the surface of photovoltaic glass, when the refractive index of the thin film is the square root of the refractive index of air and substrate , and the thickness satisfies d = λ/4n , two adjacent beams of light vibrate in opposite directions, resulting in interference cancellation, reducing the reflectivity of the film, thereby improving the photoelectric conversion efficiency of the solar cell
SiO2 is often used as a material for preparing photovoltaic glass antireflection  films because of its low refractive index , abundant content in nature, low cost, and simple preparation process

The preparation methods of AR coatings mainly include evaporation coating method, sputtering coating method , ion coating method , microemulsion method , chemical vapor deposition method, etching method, and sol-gel method

The sol-gel method has been widely used due to its advantages of less required raw materials, simple preparation method and equipment , low production cost, good ability to prepare large-area thin films, and easy industrial production

The traditional sol-gel method for the preparation of SiO2 AR film generally uses tetraethyl orthosilicate  as a hydrolysis precursor, ethanol  as the solvent, and acid or alkali as catalysts for reactions
After aging for several days, the film is coated by pulling or spin coating [10,11]

Among them, when alkali is used as a catalyst, the hydrolysis of TEOS is a nucleophilic reaction, SiO2 is in the form of particles, there is point contact between particles and particles and between particles and the matrix , the binding force is van der Waals force, leading to a higher transmittance higher while lower hardness

When acid is used as a catalyst, the hydrolysis of TEOS is an electrophilic reaction, the product has a higher degree of cross-linking, the surface of the film is denser, which increases the reflection of light, resulting in a lower transmittance while higher hardness
From the perspective of the reaction mechanism of TEOS in different catalytic systems, the transmittance and hardness of the AR coating cannot be achieved simultaneously
Therefore, it is only possible to appropriately improve one while sacrificing the other.

In order to improve the transmittance of acid-catalyzed films, a template or pore-forming agent is usually introduced during the preparation of the sol, and then decomposed to generate pores through high-temperature heating treatment, thereby increasing the transmittance of the film while sacrificing a certain hardness
Poloxamer  was employed as a pore-forming agent to prepare a superhydrophilic SiO2 AR film with good optical and mechanical properties
The average transmittance of the AR coating in the visible light region is 92.01%, the transmittance gain is 2.53%, the water contact angle  is 9°, and the hardness of H
Dimethyldiethoxysilane  was used as a pore-forming agent to prepare a new type of monolayer microporous SiO2 AR film on both sides of the substrate
The transmittance of the film is increased by 5%∼6% compared with the substrate, while the hardness remains above 2 H, the WCA is 33°, and it has good friction resistance and adhesion
Jinghua Sun et al
used triblock polymer  as a pore-forming agent , the ordered mesoporous silica optical AR coating was successfully prepared by ammonia and HMDS post-treatment

The light transmittance of AR coating on quartz substrate is as high as 99.99%, and the WCA is 88°.In addition, cetyl trimethyl ammonium bromide , polyvinylpyrrolidone , polyethylene glycol , polyethylene glycol monomethyl ether  were also used as a pore-forming agent [, ], and thus can effectively improve the transmittance of acid-catalyzed films

Although a lot of work was focused on the AR film of photovoltaic glass, it is still difficult to apply in practice, mainly because the three performance requirements of transmittance, hardness and wettability can not be satisfied at the same time.

CYMEL 303LF is a commercial-grade hexamethoxy methyl melamine resin that can be dissolved in most common organic solvents and mainly contains methoxy methyl functional groups, making it useful as a cross-linker for polymers containing hydroxyl, carboxyl, and other functional groups
Its high monomer content and low self-condensation tendency can obtain films with high flexibility and formability
Also, it exhibits high stability as well as good miscibility and solubility, and thus can be uniformly dispersed in acid-catalyzed polysiloxane polymer sol systems
Therefore, CYMEL 303LF can be employed as a pore former and sacrificial template to improve the transmittance of acid-catalyzed films

In order to balance the transmittance and hardness of acid-catalyzed film, CYMEL 303LF was added to the acid-catalyzed system as a pore-forming agent and sacrificial template, and then a porous SiO2 AR film was successfully prepared by spin coating and subsequent high-temperature heating treatment
The effect of the additional amount of CYMEL 303LF on the microstructure and properties of the films was investigated in detail.
Tetraethyl orthosilicate , hydrochloric acid , ethanol , hexamethoxy methyl melamine resin , Formamidine iodide , Lead bromide , Lead iodide , 2,2′,7,7′-Tetrakis[N,N-diamino]-9,9′-spirobifluorene
The XRD patterns of SiO2 films with different mass fractions of CYMEL 303LF was shown in Fig. 3a

It can be seen that there was no characteristic diffraction peak in the XRD pattern of each sample, only a broad diffraction peak appears between 20° and 35°, indicating that all prepared SiO2 films were amorphous [20,21], and the addition of the pore-forming agent CYMEL 303LF did not change the amorphous phase of the SiO2 film.
FTIR spectra of SiO2 films with different mass fractions of CYMEL 303LF
In this work, hexamethoxy methyl melamine resin as the pore-forming agent was decomposed at high temperature through subsequent heat treatment to prepare the porous superhydrophilic SiO2 AR film
The effects of the pore-forming agent content on the microstructure and properties of the films were investigated in detail
The introduction of hexamethoxy methyl melamine resin can significantly increase the porosity of the film, reduce the refractive index of the film, and further improve the

Metal nanoparticles, particularly silver nanoparticles , exhibit excellent antibacterial properties
However, their high mobility and Ag+ release rate can damage normal tissues and cells
Therefore, their application in wound healing is limited
Reducing Ag+ to AgNs using tannic acid  and Fe complexes  could effectively prevent the migration of AgNs and slow the release of Ag+ to achieve effective inhibition of bacteria
Ag+ was reduced to AgNs using TA/Fe coating on the surface of calcium alginate and silk fibroin peptide microspheres  to prepare novel litchi-like microspheres
CA/[email protected] showed good biocompatibility
The growth and reproduction of Staphylococcus aureus and Pseudomonas aeruginosa were completely inhibited at a CA/[email protected] concentration of 20 mg/mL
The redox reaction of Ag+ with TA/Fe resulted in the oxidation of Fe2+ to Fe3+

The hemostatic ability of CA/[email protected] was significantly enhanced owing to the good coagulation ability of TA/Fe3+ in the blood, which reduced the bleeding time and hemostatic volume of the femoral artery to 109 s and 0.115 g, respectively
Therefore, TA/Fe-modified microspheres are good carriers of AgNs that can be used for efficient bacteriostasis, rapid hemostasis, and wound healing.
In developing quicker, smaller, and more efficient optoelectronic devices, composite thin films are becoming progressively crucial
One reason for using composite thin films is to improve materials optical and electrical properties
Thermal Evaporation is a type of physical vapor deposition that can produce thin films with well-controlled nanostructures that are pure, homogeneous, and conformal
The prime focus of this study was to fabricate TiO2 and composite TiO2:ZnO thin films on ITO-coated glass substrates by thermal Evaporation
The goal of this study was to investigate the optical, structural, and electrical properties of deposited thin films
The optical properties were assessed using UV–Vis and Photoluminescence spectroscopy, and FTIR spectroscopy was used to identify the fingerprint of materials
The crystal structure of deposited thin films was investigated using X-ray diffraction
The changes in morphology induced by adding ZnO content to TiO2 were examined using optical microscopy
SEM investigation corroborated the granular-like structure of thin films, whereas EDX demonstrated the doping and composition of ZnO concentration in TiO2
The electrical measurements were performed using the Van der Pauw technique
Adding ZnO into TiO2 improved transmission, photoconductivity, and optical bandgap to generate a viable electron transport material  for efficient perovskite solar cells
XRD results revealed the grain size increase after adding ZnO into TiO2
The transmission was increased to 95%, while the bandgap was decreased from 3.8 eV to 3.68 eV
It was also revealed that after integrating ZnO into TiO2, the generated thin films have stronger visible photoluminescence peaks, and the material's conductivity has been improved
The results indicate that TiO2:ZnO could be employed as an ETM in PSC to improve productivity.

Photocatalytic reduction is currently one of the most promising methods for the removal of heavy metal hexavalent chromium ions from aqueous environments, for which increasing focus has been directed towards heterostructure engineering of the existing photocatalysts, like SrTiO3

In this work, mesoporous heterostructured SrCO3-SrTiO3 microspheres constructed from nanosheets were synthesized by a facile one-step solvothermal method using ethylene glycol  and water as mixed solvents and exhibited enhanced photocatalytic performance in the degradation of 99.78% for the reduction of Cr under UV irradiation for 3 min compared with pure SrTiO3 microspheres, which is better than that of most photocatalysts in the previous works

The enhancement in the photocatalytic performance was probably attributed to the formed heterostructures between SrCO3 and SrTiO3 grains which can facilitate the transfer of photo-induced electrons from the conduction band  of SrTiO3 to CB of SrCO3, and adsorbed EG molecules which can consume the holes in valence band  of SrTO3, thus reducing the recombination of photo-induced carriers

In addition, the mesoporous structures with a large surface area can provide more active sites for the adsorption of Cr and thus accelerate subsequent reduction reaction of Cr with photo-induced electrons
Therefore, this work can provide a facile way to prepare high-performance photocatalysts for highly efficient and low-cost removal of Cr.
Defect-free perovskite materials are necessary for developing efficient solar cells
On FTO-glass substrates , cadmium-doped methylammonium lead bromide  films have been deposited
Doping does not affect the cubic crystal structure of MAPbBr3; however, it has increased the grain size, according to XRD
The band gap is decreased at 3% of Cd doping, due to which the deep-level traps are decreased
Every cell shows good performance, but the cell formed with 3% Cd doping has a high fill factor , open circuit voltage , considerable short-circuit current density , and efficiency
The high open circuit voltages and current density refer to the accumulation of charges at the holes and electrons transport layers being reduced due to Cd doping.
SiO2 nanomaterials are widely used for antireflection and self-cleaning, but the preparation process is usually complex and time-consuming
Hence, we present a facile one-step synthesis of a hydrophobic two-dimensional SiO2 nanomesh by tuning the reaction temperature using dodecylamine as a catalyst
SiO2 nanomesh has the advantages of an adjustable refractive index, simple preparation process, and low cost, which affords both antireflection and self-cleaning functions for solar cells
Two types of perovskite solar cells were used to verify the stability and universality of the SiO2 nanomesh coatings

The antireflection effect of the SiO2 nanomesh is found to increase the current density of both perovskite solar cells fabricated at 500 °C and 150 °C, with the efficiency increased by 4.48% and 4.79%, respectively.
Poor performance and instability due to high trap-state density severely restrict commercial application of perovskite solar cells
Interface modification with appropriate materials is an effective way to passivate perovskite defects and improve device stability
Herein, a second-phase of perovskite [TA]PbClI2 was in-situ grown from first-phase of TACl reacted with remnant PbI2 atop perovskite film during the post-treatment process

As the spacer ion of lead-halide polyhedron, TA+ effectively passivates the defects at the interface through chemical bond cooperation and hydrogen bond interaction, and synergies with well-formed energy level arrangement and improved carrier transportation
Ultimately, the power conversion efficiency  of the devices is promoted from 20.27% to 22.53%

Moreover, [TA]PbClI2 acts as a robust barrier on the perovskite surface due to its low-dimensional structure and hydrophobicity, which obviously enhances the long-term and humidity stability of the solar cells

PSCs with [TA]PbClI2 can retain 83% of its initial efficiency after 255 days in N2 atmosphere, and maintain 60% after 216 h in air under 60% relative humidity, compared to 67% and 28% for the control one, respectively.
The authors contributed equally.
